definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Love, is the youth frenzy years round of apricot yellow months, fine but hazy.
sentences.chinese: 爱情，是青春迷乱岁月里的一轮杏黄月，美好而朦胧。

sentences.english: I'm in a daze and some days still can't believe my great fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在这段时间里，我依旧迷乱而不敢相信自己的好运气。

sentences.english: I can not imagine the confusion it must cause the victim.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象，那会导致受害者怎样的迷乱困惑。

sentences.english: Had contradictions to the original Soundwave, so they changed him to Frenzy.
sentences.chinese: 和原始的声波存在矛盾，因此被改名为迷乱。

sentences.english: However, by the 1960s, economic policies were floundering.
sentences.chinese: 然而60年代的经济政策有些迷乱。

sentences.english: Air increasingly Hui Leng, confusion between this city with streets paved with injuries.
sentences.chinese: 空气越来越灰冷，这城市之间迷乱着遍地伤情。

definition: confusion/unable to escape from infatuation or addiction
